field.name: Persistent Diarrhoea with No Dehydration | Take Action
Check for HIV infection, if trained
Advise the mother/caregiver on feeding a child who has persistent diarrhoea, as given below:
If child is still exclusively breastfeeding, give more frequent, longer breastfeeds both day and night
If child is still breastfeeding, and other foods have been introduced:
Replace with more frequent, longer breastfeeds OR
Replace half the milk with thick porridge prepared with clean water
If child is no longer breastfeeding, following feeding recommendation for a sick child
Give daily doses of multivitamins/mineral supplements to take for 14 days
Give zinc tablets (only for children aged 2 months – 5 years)
Advise mother to continue breastfeeding, if child still breastfeeds. Observe mother breastfeeding and provide counseling on breast attachment and positioning, if necessary
Counsel mother/caregiver on feeding a sick child
Advise mother/caregiver when to return for care immediately
Advise mother/caregiver to return after 5 days if condition does not improve
Record clinical care in Child Health Record “green” book
